website_summaries.verdict: The Logitech Squeezebox Radio has an exceptional design, an unmatched variety of streaming music services, and solid sonics, making it the top value pick for Wi-Fi radios.
pros: Wi-Fi radio with built-in speaker and color LCD display
stylish exterior design and outstanding button placement on front panel
can access thousands of freely available Internet radio stations
streams tons of online music services (Pandora, Last.fm, Slacker, Rhapsody, Sirius, Live Music Archive)
provides access to PC-based music files (on Windows, Mac, and Linux machines)
supports nearly every digital audio file format, including lossless formats like FLAC and Apple Lossless
optional battery pack allows for portable operation
can control the radio using a Web browser or iPeng iPhone app
cons: Remote and battery pack cost extra
slightly more expensive than competing radios
setup could scare off tech novices
doesn't sound quite as good as the Squeezebox Boom

customer_reviews.title: Perhaps the best piece of consumer electronics I have ever bought.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this little internet radio 11 years ago. It's still going strong, although we did have to replace the battery a year or so ago. The sound quality is exceptional. We have used it for hours every day since we bought it — I'm guessing at least 20,000 hours total. It's portable and can be easily carried around the house or out into the garden. It's so much easier to use than using an iPhone connected to a Bluetooth speaker. We use it to listen to our local NPR radio station but also to our favorite foreign radio stations such as France Culture and France Inter, and also to podcasts. I can't understand why it was discontinued by Logitech.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Doniach

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, elegantly designed world radio
customer_reviews.text: Love these Logitech Slim Devices. Well made and elegant with excellent quality sound for size. Lost 3 of these in a house fire, bought this one to replace. It works great, like new. Was discouraged to see Logitech discontinued the line. Problem when a big company buys an innovative startup, then drops it later. We like the simplicity and sound of these units. Just push any one of the 6 save buttons and you are instantly listening to Paris, Seattle, Montevideo, Brazzaville or wherever you please in the world.
customer_reviews.author: jgates

customer_reviews.title: Great radio for streaming internet stations.
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my Dutch immigrant mother. It took her awhile to get used to how to tune it, but now that she understands the process she gets a LOT of enjoyment out of listening to Dutch radio, in the northwest corner of the U.S. Sound is clear, and it is pretty easy to set up. Even though she has a fairly slow Internet connection, she has never had any problem with the stream.
customer_reviews.author: W. FLANAGAN

customer_reviews.title: A great radio going to the dust  bins of past radio worked really fine.
customer_reviews.text: So so sad that the great company called Logitech got out of the development of the famous wifi computer generated radios. That company develop a fine radio line Y
customer_reviews.author: michael Labadie

customer_reviews.title: Nice Sound but...
customer_reviews.text: The only problem with Logitech is that they don't seem to have good partnerships with the streaming companies. To get Spotify, one has to pay for the premium service. It does get Slacker, but I have to pay a monthly fee to Slacker. Pandora is the only service I can stream without paying a monthly fee. But truth be told, it is very nice to just push a button and hear the music that you want to hear. The sleep timer is a real bonus as you can go to sleep to your favorite music. I don't know that I would recommend this as the most "open" platform, but the music that it does stream sounds pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: Luz

customer_reviews.title: Best...
customer_reviews.text: Best internet radio I've ever had, i purchased my first one 10+ years ago, was stoked to find a used in excellent condition radio on Amazon. Sadly logitech discontinued this product.
customer_reviews.author: G

customer_reviews.title: That sucks. Also
customer_reviews.text: The promise of this radio, some years ago, was that it would work seamlessly in the chain of my network and other peripherals. I have had lots of trouble with it over time and have never been able to use it wirelessly. That sucks. Also, difficult to get Logitech to support it, and let's not talk about the Smart Radio Controller software... when the !@^!@^#& app can actually find the radio it worked.. for a few weeks. Then - nothing! I guess it's time to go for another brand of this product.
customer_reviews.author: Bernard bruce

customer_reviews.title: Warning:  Discontinued Product Line means...
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy this product. Buy the newer UE Smart Radio. I have this product and it's wonderful. It's easy to setup, sounds great, absolutely love it. But, Logitech has discontinued the entire product line. At first they said they were just going to stop providing server maintenance for it. There was a revolt from loyal customers and they have agreed to keep the server going but for how long? I have resigned myself that this will be a brick someday. Finally, for those that love Spotify, you must have a premium account to us it on either product.
customer_reviews.author: Bill C

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: I have long wanted this radio. but it came without instruction and without original packaging. and a bit shabby. it is immediately apparent that they used it. vexed
customer_reviews.author: Daria Koko

customer_reviews.title: I'm delighted with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: After reading some of the negative reviews, I was apprehensive about setting up my squeezebox. But I had no problems at all. The instructions packed with the unit are very terse, so I found a YouTube video of the setup, which proved to be quite helpful. I also recommend visiting the mysqueezebox.com Web site and using their "Remote Control" for setting up your favorites. It's much easier than using the radio interface. Update as of November 2011: I purchased a second Squeezebox, which I carry with me from room to room when I'm working around the house. I got the accessory battery, which allows you to unplug the radio and plug it in again without rebooting.
customer_reviews.author: John Isner

customer_reviews.title: Great internet radio!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a replacement for my dead Roku Soundbridge radio. I have been very happy with it. The sound quality is very good. Not quite the sound quality of the Soundbridge but still very good. Note: I listen primarily to "talk" radio but will listen to music occasionally. The color display is excellent. The idea that you can load and use certain applets is a good idea. It's easy to navigate. The fact that you can get a battery pack and make this a portable radio (within your wifi range) is a great feature. The only minor disappointments are: a) only has 6 station presets. b) battery pack not yet available.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Squeezebox Radio
customer_reviews.text: The Squeezebox Radio is a good product for the feature set and the price point. pros: -sound quality is fantastic for the size, is really fills up a room with music. -appears to be quality construction and looks good -wifi works flawlessly and was relatively easy to setup -you can control the device by logging in to the logitech web site cons: -interfacing shared music on your local machine requires a server client to be installed -switching from local shared music to internet radio is a chore and is not a smooth integration -would be nice if a radio tuner or a hd radio tuner would have been included also
customer_reviews.author: Don Burgess

customer_reviews.title: Bought For Radio station Giveaway with debut of Streaming, found to be of excellent quality!
customer_reviews.text: This radio has a great "feel", and a very nice sound. While you do have to turn the volume (what seems) a bit higher physically than expected, the sound quality for a small to medium room is very nice. Excellent display, readable from a greater distance than many due to its simplicity (referring to the clock.) Generated much excitement with our debut of streaming on our radio station and was a nice giveaway. Bought by recommendation because it can manually accept streams that are not in the 'net directory or existing internal memory. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: W. RADIO

customer_reviews.title: A winner!
customer_reviews.text: This radio is nothing less than fantastic. The sound quality is totally amazing, even though it is a small unit. How nice to hear AM stations with a crystal-clear sound, and it is so much easier than using our computer to find new internet stations. As a Christmas gift for my husband, my intention was for it to be a replacement for our current iHome clock radio, but we enjoy this radio so much that we hate the thought of delegating it to the bedroom! I did have to contact Logitech regarding a question, and the customer service was stellar. Do not hesitate to buy the Logitech Squeezebox radio. You won't regret your purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing interface, buggy operation, lack of updates and product support
customer_reviews.text: This product could be so cool with a little more effort. Freezes up when loading spotify playlists, then has to go through a 10-minute reboot. Menus difficult to navigate. Lots of lag between screens. Disappointing interface. Thankfully there is a smart-phone app that works slightly better and can be used to send music to the squeezebox directly without using this annoying interface on the radio itself. Still...the only way this provides headache-free operation is by plugging into the stereo with an auxillary cord on the back of the unit, which is sad. A $10 radio can do that for me.
customer_reviews.author: NE

customer_reviews.title: It's on all the time!
customer_reviews.text: I got this Internet radio for my wife as a Christmas present. She was THRILLED! We have it on all the time...in the kitchen/family room and in her home office. We have already used up the presets...wish it had more. No PC to boot up. In fact we just hit a preset and it's playing our favorite music and LOTS of it. I also installed the server component to our Windows Home server and stream our own tunes with it. We're already talking about getting another one since the wireless reception is so good. One for every room? If you love music from the Internet, this little device sounds good and is worth the money. Don't you just love technology?
customer_reviews.author: CD3

customer_reviews.title: love it!  catch radio from all over!
customer_reviews.text: We got this a while ago and I cannot explain how much I love this alarm. We live in an area where we don't have any great selection of radio stations. I would wake up to bad music or scratchy and seemingly mis-tuned stations before. This radio has so many features on it to pull in radio stations from all over, fade the volume in or you can wake up to sounds built in to the radio too. Now we wake up to radio stations that sound great and this alarm works well! We have considered a central receiver for the rest of the house too. This squeezebox has been a great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Karen P

customer_reviews.title: Cute, Easy and Lots of Music
customer_reviews.text: I really love this radio. It was easy to setup, once I plugged it in and hooked it up, it just took minutes to walk through the instructions and soon I had my favorite stations on the radio. Also- setting it up so that it can read your computer and play all the music you have stored is dead easy and makes this so much more than just a radio. A bonus for me, the small size means I can have it wherever I want. And it is red, my favorite color, no boring black radios for me! Sound quality could be better, but I wasn't looking for that, I know radios tend to be that way.
customer_reviews.author: Deni Lou

customer_reviews.title: Not an alarm clock but......
customer_reviews.text: Great little internet radio with (for it's size) acceptable sound, easy to connect to WIFI, and generally easy to find stations that you like based on your interest. This really isn't set up to function at a clock radio though, no snooze bar, limited ability to set and turn on the alarm, that's not what you want it for. It's a nice kitchen, laundry, dorm radio and if Logitech would like to invest in making it a capable clock radio was as well, then let them do it. Asking $70 to get a remote with a rechargeable battery for the radio is a total rip, talking $15 dollars, come on Logitech!!!!
customer_reviews.author: holson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent little internet radio
customer_reviews.text: This guy is not awesome but not shabby speakers. Nice middle of the road sound (which I would expect from the price). I have no connectivity problems with my WiFi. It's interface is fairly straightforward. Minimal setup time. My only complaint is that it is non-intuitive to setup as a streaming music system from your computer. That setup is a bit involved and non-intuitive. I've been primarily using it for internet radio and pandora which is excels at though. Also the smart phone control app is lovely and I highly recommend it. It's probably easier to drive with the app than the built in interface!
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Belated review on an outdated item
customer_reviews.text: I am really surprised that I had not written a review for this item. I bought this almost five years ago. I have been using it since and very happy with it. For its size, it has an excellent sound reproduction. May be if I have to buy something similar again, I would go in for something bigger in the same category. It provides hours of amazing entertainment. Unfortunately, Logitech have discontinued this. Maybe other items have come into the market, which makes this player redundant. Sad to see it go.
customer_reviews.author: PRINCE

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: I only use this as an internet radio and it works well. Having the battery pack makes this a portable having a good range from my 'n' router. It is susceptible to my laptop with wireless mouse along with my microwave oven and will sometimes not re-acquire the router after dropping out. Sound quality is good and so much better than having 2 cheap "stereo speakers" as with other portables. The amount of radio stations of all types which are using the internet is amazing and there are certainly enough to please everyone. Great idea, nice radio, and a lot of fun.
customer_reviews.author: P. Btica

customer_reviews.title: Very good product!
customer_reviews.text: I got the Logitech Squeezebox 2 days ago. It took me roughly 10 minutes to set it up and play it. I'm amazed by its user friendly multiple features and the quality of the sound it produces. Its small LCD has a very good resolution compared to my Philips NP1100. It beats the Philips NP1100 in how well are organized the radio directories. The device setups can be done from an internet account or directly on the device. The design is sleek, the wireless reception is excellent. This is a fantastic product for which I paid only a fraction of the price I paid for the Philips NP1100: 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: Jean Pierro

customer_reviews.title: Haven't found any good workaround, except to move the ones with the ...
customer_reviews.text: I now have 6 of these. Main issue with them is varying problems with WiFi, depending on the HW model and access point. Effects are that the device looses wifi connectivity and needs to get rebooted. Haven't found any good workaround, except to move the ones with the biggest problems to a wired location.
customer_reviews.author: te36

customer_reviews.title: CRYSTAL CLEAR LOCAL RADIO!
customer_reviews.text: The first experience with the Logitech Squeezebox is amazing. After spending your whole life with the noisy poor quality of AM on your car radio, and then hearing this...truly amazing. It is like you are in the radio studio! Add to that all the other internet stations and the color screen, this is a winner.
customer_reviews.author: Roy Lange

customer_reviews.title: A Good Product
customer_reviews.text: The unit sounds good in spite of the small size of the box. The rechargeable batteries are necessary to give portability to the unit which is a nice advantage. I have two of the larger Logitec Boom table top units that work well and have a bit more sound but I like the smaller unit for two reasons: 1)It is portable, 2) It has a more responsive interface. I recommend this radio with no hesitation. I don't have any of the buggy issues as some of the posts report. FWIW I have Comcast cable internet service with a Belkin wireless router. Cheers
customer_reviews.author: B J.

customer_reviews.title: Great radio!
customer_reviews.text: I love not having to start up my computer to listen to popular internet-only radio stations, or radio stations from other cities. The sound is clear and easy to hear. If you have a slower connection, you can adjust the cache time to account for fluctuations in network speeds. I did have a little bit of a problem with set-up, as the scroll wheel takes some getting used to when using it to enter in the WPA2 wireless password. Being able to control it from an internet site as well as create custom alarms is a bonus. Great product! I will probably purchase additional units for other rooms.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Kane

customer_reviews.title: It does what I bought it for
customer_reviews.text: playing my (many!) playlists on Rhapsody, and does it beautifully. I also use some of the suggested internet radio aps, and they work fine. The problem I had getting it to find my WiFi was my ISP's fault, but their customer rep worked with me and changed my modem settings so that it now works fine. I've had it for months now, and have experienced no problems with it. In fact, I wish I had a second one. The menu for choosing what I want to listen to is a bit tricky to navigate, which is the only thing that kept me from giving it all five stars.
customer_reviews.author: The Owl Underground

customer_reviews.title: Squeezebox a hit!
customer_reviews.text: Squeezebox table radio is better than expected. Sound quality is very good and the unit itself has an attractive design. I would only suggest that the manufacturer might include a little more detailed manual of instructions for use. The unit's capabilities are many and a little more explanation of how to take advantage of all the menu options would have been helpful. It took a while for me to figure out all of the features I use most frequently and I am still not sure I am getting full benefit. Otherwise, I have no problem in recommending this unit to anyone looking for a quality WIFI radio.
customer_reviews.author: TJS

customer_reviews.title: just what i wanted
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a simple way to enjoy my xm radio while at home. I listen to my xm radio in the car and had gotten a boom box that allows me to un-dock my car xm radio and take it in my house to listen in the boom box, but this was not very convenient. I've had the Logitech Squeezebox for almost a week now and have used it every day. I purchased based off of the other reviews and I am very pleased with it so far. It was also easy to setup thanks to the other reviews that explained what to do.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart Miller

customer_reviews.title: great seller, product good but signal issue
customer_reviews.text: seller sent on timely basis and had no issues. The product itself is very likable but there are quite a few times where it was just stop in a middle of a song, I'm guessing my signal isn't that great. It might need to be closer to my router but the way my place is set up I really can't make it closer. all in all great sound, nice size, like the alarm function but doesn't come with remote (you have to buy separately) and the dropped signal is a little annoying esp if it's on a song I like! I end up having to turn it off and back on to re-set.
customer_reviews.author: lipsealed

customer_reviews.title: Nice radio
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this to replace a satelite radio we had in our office (which we have music being playerd all day throuought our offices with an amp & wired speakers throughout the office. This radio is a perfect fit with great features and more stations than one could imagine between internet radio stations, pandora, etc. for the price. We have the same exact radio at home as well - which led me to make this purchase for the office. The only drawback with the one we use in our office is that we sometimes have to reset the internet connection. Not sure if its a problem with our wireless router & , etc. or not.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Coladonato, CPA

customer_reviews.title: A little buggy, but good product
customer_reviews.text: A great way to add music to every room without having to run wires or blare the stereo too loud in one room to hear it in another. You can have something different in each room or synchronize them o play the same thing in multiple rooms. The sound quality is very nice, but not stereo. The price is a little high, and sometimes you have to fiddle around to get them to synch properly, but not often. They will play your music files, internet radio station and with apps you can play your Sirius/XM favorites and even your Pandora stations.
customer_reviews.author: S. Boyd

customer_reviews.title: A great guy gift
customer_reviews.text: I have been a Sirius satellite subscriber for years. However, we weren't using our home Sirius set-up much but paying a monthly fee. I got the Smash Box for my husband so he could listen to the radio anywhere in the house. It is a portable unit as I'd hoped and the sound is great. We now only pay for an internet subsription to Sirius, which is a big savings. For some reason the Sirius stations will play for a while and then just stop, it seems to be something with permissions. I'm sure we'll figure it out soon enough. This is a great product!
customer_reviews.author: K. Fehringer

customer_reviews.title: Buggy. Still like it.
customer_reviews.text: If you can be forgiving of some bugs and intermittent reliability issues in a feature-rich, technically complex product, you'll love this. Frequently it refuses to operate, but is fixable with a reboot (unplug for a bit). Fun and convenient to control it from web browser. Will be a frustrating nightmare and end up in the attic or trash if you have no tolerance for gadgets that don't 'just work' and need some babying. Still, a good value for the features and price (when on sale).
customer_reviews.author: John Shea

customer_reviews.title: Great radio simple yet elegant
customer_reviews.text: I love this radio! it actually sounds like a stereo since it is a digital radio. no other fees to pay except for this device and you yet a lot of channels you can scan to your liking. It even gives you very informative stuff like the actual album cover of the music and who the artist is. You can even manipulate the screen to your liking like color feature and different looking clocks and it has a music alarm to wake you up. It's awesome I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Vincent Pardo

customer_reviews.title: Squeezebox Radio
customer_reviews.text: I found out about Squeezebox Radio from my wife's brother's family. It is wonderful. Now I can listen to WFMT Chicago, WCPE Raleigh-Durham, BBC Cymru, an excellent Turkish station with more traditional Turkish music, and old time radio without resorting to any antennas, cables, etc. I would recommend this product to anyone who, like me, was a child during the days of classic radio or who likes to listem to world-wide radio without investing a fortune in international shortwave radio equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS
customer_reviews.text: ok -- There is not much better than this.. seriously. Portable, so you can put it where you are.. Smallish, so you can NOT take up a bunch of space which makes it easy for office, patio, kitchen and bedroom. Good sound as well! I was looking for this to be a more permanent fixture in the workshop at some point but I found the larger one.. better speakers and the portable one is sooooo nice for office and kitchen.. I think I'll get the larger one down the road. Does anyone know if you can add speakers to this?
customer_reviews.author: Darcy

customer_reviews.title: We connect it to powered Bose speakers and the sound quaity is very good. I would reccommend a software remote controller
customer_reviews.text: We have been using this internet radio for many years. We connect it to powered Bose speakers and the sound quaity is very good. I would reccommend a software remote controller. We use the iPing app on our iPad Pro.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Miller

customer_reviews.title: Makes cleaning my kitchen more enjoyable
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE 10/04/15: No longer plays SiriusXM. I bought the Grace Digital version. May 2012: I bought this to play Sirius satellite radio in my kitchen. I'm very happy with it. I like that it also plays my mp3 songs from my computer through the wireless router network. The radio does mysteriously stop sometimes, but I don't know if that's the radio or something goofy with my router. I wish the battery and remote were included. I may buy the battery so I can take it out to the patio.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine

customer_reviews.title: A very nice internet radio.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased Logitech Squeezebox for my wife who wanted to be able to listen to her favorite radio programs that were taking off the air locally but were still broadcast online. The setup isn't too bad for someone with computer knowledge. If you want to move it around I suggest you get the optional battery and remote. My wife is always unplugging it from the wall and taking it with her to somewhere else in the house or even outside. The sound quality is very good for such a small radio.
customer_reviews.author: R. W. Draper

customer_reviews.title: small but powerful
customer_reviews.text: Compact. If you want an internet radio that can fill a small space (home office, say) this works great sonically. If you can have the controls at your side, this model allows you to hit different presets (six in all), or, by tuning with the center knob (easy to do, as there are presets there, too, and searching for stations, in depth, from places you'd never guess -- this is an "internet" radio after all),easy as well. If you don't have the radio at your side, best to buy the remote that is sold separately.
customer_reviews.author: zebraguy

customer_reviews.title: Internet Radio at its best!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely Love my Squeezebox! It connects to wifi so I can take it out in the backyard and listen to my Pandora stations. I have even taken it with me on vacation and hooked up to my daughter's wifi so I never have to be without great entertainment. Easy to follow directions to set the radio up and program your preferences. Great sound for a little unit too! Will also function as an alarm clock! This was the perfect solution to my listening needs.
customer_reviews.author: Mesmereyes

customer_reviews.title: Love my Squeezebox!
customer_reviews.text: This is actually the second squeezebox I bought. I just love it. I have it setup to be able to stream all of my local music on my PC, but it also has access to thousands of online radio stations. It is fairly easy to control via the hardware, but typing in text is tedious and annoying. The good thing is there are smartphone apps which make this device a breeze to operate! There may be a bit of a learning curve for non-techies, but I had no problem learning how to use this device.
customer_reviews.author: D. Brubaker

customer_reviews.title: Important part of our lives
customer_reviews.text: We are currently living overseas and our Squeezebox allows us to keep up with all of our favorite NPR shows, listen to world news on the BBC, and practice our French on France Culture. It was very simple to set up and it allows us to tune in to virtually any station around the world. I know we could do all this on our computers but this is just like turning on the radio, what could be simpler? At this point it is one of our most prized appliances.
customer_reviews.author: Alex G. Mendoza

customer_reviews.title: Amazed
customer_reviews.text: This product has gone beyond expectations. The connection to the wireless network went flawlessly as well as the connection to my PC. The sound for such a small unit is really amazing. The features and ease of use are also a breeze. If I had to find something not perfect with this unit, is the fact that is not stereo in the main speaker, however, if you want stereo you can always use headphones which is the application I really wanted it for. I recommend this radio without reservations!
customer_reviews.author: Val F. De Guardia

customer_reviews.title: Squeezebox radio (old version)
customer_reviews.text: Best sound I have ever experienced from a small radio. It is in use every day using internet station presets. High quality product, a little awkward to set-up initially if you are not completely wifi tech savvy. Well worth the time to activate though. Solid performance, and did I mention the sound--you will not believe it. After set up, just touch the button to listen to a preset and enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: fairweather

customer_reviews.title: Best Birthday Gift Ever
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband for his birthday last August and it is the best gift I have ever given him. He uses it every day. I also bought the optional battery pack with remote. I believe this is a must. He takes the radio outside and sits on the back porch and listens to music while he smokes his cigar or while he is just hanging out with friends. Everybody loves it and when they come over they always end up putting in request for what type of music to listen to. I would highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: backer

customer_reviews.title: Entertaining in a Small footprint
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to set up and use. Connects to my home network and plays music fro my desktop Media Player Library,, my laptop library, Pandora, Local and Internet world stations. Has alarm, and sounds to relax to also. Have gotten Software updates that added even more features and new interface graphics. Use it in my bedroom, as the size doesn't fill a very large room as richly as a smaller one. Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Grimes

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing!
customer_reviews.text: Got this as a christmas gift this year and it's wonderful. It has great sound considering it's a tabletop radio. I have been able to find all of my local radio stations to stream on this as well. If you have an iphone be sure to grab the ipeng app - it lets you control this radio from your iphone! I did have a little problem with this and my Netgear Wireless router - the Squeezebox didnt like my shared key wireless settings for some reason. I made a change on the router and it fixed the issue.
customer_reviews.author: BrianAx

customer_reviews.title: Not just geeky cool, just cool
customer_reviews.text: The ONLY downsides to this product are A) Cost, and B) instruction manuals are feeble. Setup is a breeze if you have an okay knowledge of home wireless networking. Get ready to explore all the functionality of this device tho, it's not just a radio. Alarm works great, too. One notable, if you're connecting this with Napster and use Napster to go software, it will NOT see your local playlists, etc UNLESS you also create them on Napster's web-based service. I know, stupid, right?
customer_reviews.author: USERBOSCO

customer_reviews.title: Almost Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: The functionality and ease of use of this radio put it far ahead of the rest of the field in Internet radio systems. In addition to the standard thousands of Internet radio stations, this system includes Pandora, Napster, and a number of other apps that make it an excellent value. The only negatives are the software/firmware is still a little buggy and in need of an update, and there isn't a remote in the box. The software issues are rare, and the remote is a coming add-on, so they aren't critical but they are preventing me from giving this rousing "5" ratings all around.
customer_reviews.author: B. Schueler

customer_reviews.title: Squeeze Box versus Sirius
customer_reviews.text: Great radio! I have 2 lifetime subscriptions to Siruis and have bought Squeeze Box radios and I like and really enjoy the Squeeze Box more. Also, I have a Sirius Internet subscription (cost $3 per month) and my Squeeze Box picks up all the Sirius radio station because the Squeeze Box is an internet radio. All radio stations are FREE and more than you can ever use. Note: you do not have to have the Internet Sirus just wireless internet from your home computer.
customer_reviews.author: Terrence Barton

customer_reviews.title: We love this!
customer_reviews.text: We have always had an electical interference issue at our house and it got so bad we couldn't listen to our favorite radio programs. Then we listened to them online. That's ok but doesn't reach thru the house, not loud enough. This little radio is easy to set up, starts working right away and NO crackling. We are loving it. And we can take it out on the deck with us in the summer. This is a great little radio!
customer_reviews.author: maplady

customer_reviews.title: fine, when it works, may be more trouble than you care to have
customer_reviews.text: On more than one occasion the squeezebox has completely lost its settings (which it gets from the Logitech website where you register it)...all custom stations, apps, gone. More than once I have had to reconfigure from scratch...a hassle at best. If the logitech site is down, you get nothing. In my case, no wireless problems, the radio has an ethernet connection...still loses settings.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: I just received it today. Well packaged and protected I opened it up. I had followed another reviewer's advice and set up my free Squeezebox account on their website. So all I did was to plug it in, connect it to my wi-fi and log in my account and I was off in less than 5 minutes! The sound is great. I don't have to turn it up much at all to hear it all over my house (not that I have a huge house but it's not extremely tiny either). Great purchase, very nice looking.
customer_reviews.author: SANDRA

customer_reviews.title: Great out-of-box experience
customer_reviews.text: The FedEx guy dropped this off this morning. I couldn't belive how easy this was to set up. I entered my wireless password, it automatically downloaded and installed a firmware update, I created a Squeezebox account via the radio controls and I was all done! It even used my IP address info to automatically set up a list of local radio stations to choose to stream. One minor quibble so far - when you turn the radio on it doesn't start playing the station that was streaming when you turned it off, until you also hit the "Play" button.
customer_reviews.author: Peter D. Henry

customer_reviews.title: Nice way to get music & other programs from anywhere around the world.
customer_reviews.text: An appreciated gift to my Mom, who lives out of the country & is legally blind. She has trouble navigating the buttons on her CD player & playing music. She missed it so much! She also missed talk programs. This has provided music & talk channels for her. I did not give it 5 stars because she is still having trouble programming it, but most people will probably not have that problem. I'd like to get one for myself.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: The Squeezebox system is awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I have several Squeezbox devices including this Squeezebox Radio. They are solid players with excellent fidelity. The functionality for all the players is very good . It does take some time to learn all of the interactions between the functions, but, once learned, the Squeezboxes are awesome . I can listen to so many radio stations over the world with no static and some stations having CD quality. Also, adding music services , provides an unending selection of your favorite music genres . The world is my oyster since I found the Squeezes.
customer_reviews.author: Ikabob

customer_reviews.title: Simple to use...
customer_reviews.text: I can say it does exactly what I have read about it. Simple to use and understand. The cons of it is the setup the password protected WIFI. This is not totally explained and took some working to make conection to my network using wireless. Really the system should have the ability to accept HEX converted as TEXT. Converting HEX from TEXT passwords takes some time to understand. I recommend that you google out converting Text to Hex for either the 64 bit 10 character or the 128 16 character. Otherwise it works great....
customer_reviews.author: Bentnail

customer_reviews.title: Very cool
customer_reviews.text: I have absolutely nothing negative to say about this little device. The sound is terrific for such a small size. The menu layout is great and the headphone jack is an added plus for night time listening when my wife is sleeping. I charge it on my nightstand and fall asleep while listening to podcasts or my Pandora music stations. Then I carry it around the house, during the day using battery power. (Make sure you order the battery pack; It really comes in handy)
customer_reviews.author: Sand Spur

customer_reviews.title: Good for music, excelent for radio
customer_reviews.text: Had it for +2 years, it never gave me any problems for listening to the Radio around the world (sometimes some radios are down, but that has to do with their own internet service)... the same goes for the different services associated (ie Pandora) Listening to the music in our computers (I have several in my house) was a bit more complicated, as the server not always "saw" all the computers and was not easy to change from one to another.
customer_reviews.author: V&M

customer_reviews.title: Squeezebox Radio
customer_reviews.text: This is my second purchase of a Logitech Squeezebox. Being able to listen to any kind of music without commercial interruptions is really a plus. I am having a problem with synching the two boxes, but only getting the volume between the two to coincide. I'm sure it's something I'm doing wrong during setup. Other than that they synch fine. What surprised me is the sound quality. Very good. I really enjoy listening to my Squeezboxes.
customer_reviews.author: Dclifford47

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful radio!
customer_reviews.text: This is an absolutely wonderful wifi radio. It is easy to learn to use and has so many features that I have not yet used most of them. It is great to be able to listen to radio stations all over the USA and even the world. I enjoyed the radio so much that I purchased a second one and may buy even more. In fact, I will probably never buy another non-wifi radio. My only "wish" is that it might have more than 6 pre-set buttons, because there are so many stations that I would like to "save" for easy use.
customer_reviews.author: Paul B Van Buren

customer_reviews.title: Very nice!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to tie in with Squeezebox Server software (free) running on a MS Home Server machine along with a Logitech Duet player already installed in the great room. Setup to sync with the Duet was problematic because of poor documentation, but the Logitech customer support guy was great (answered on the 2nd ring!) and found the answer after some digging. I love this thing. My old clock radio went into the goodwill box. Now I can select and play 60+ GB's of music (on the server), Pandora & internet radio with a couple of clicks. Swapping disks & AM/FM radio are dead forever!
customer_reviews.author: David Smith

customer_reviews.title: feel like home
customer_reviews.text: I live in Houston and my wife is Californian when my origin are european, what a pleasure for both of us to feel home by listening to all the radio channel we was used to listening before, this wifi radio is so easy to use program and really play with it, you like listening to airplane control, cops radio for different cities or radio around the worl the squeezebox will be wonderful for you.
customer_reviews.author: STEPHANE BOUSSON

customer_reviews.title: Sweet little Internet radio
customer_reviews.text: Quite happy with this unit so far. Wifi hookup very quick. Gets all the stations plus Pandora, etc. Love the remote app for smartphones, iPad. Would like a battery pack, but they only offer with a remote and I don't need or want to buy one of those. Sound OK, but not great. Only use it with headphones, tho, so not a problem for me. Wasn't expecting concert hall sound from the speaker. With the Squeezebox website, can do it all.
customer_reviews.author: P. Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Not too excited about it
customer_reviews.text: I already own the squeezebox boom which I thought was cumbersome to use and had plenty of lock-ups, etc. This one having a display I hoped it will be easier, not exactly... Full of bugs, sound quality is poor, can't adjust bass, all in all it's too expensive for what it offers. It does the job of an internet radio but I guess my expectations were too high, hoping to get the squeezebox boom sound out of this box
customer_reviews.author: VP

customer_reviews.title: Great but with a learning curve
customer_reviews.text: Great sound quality, lots of options for listening, good looking. I needed to read the manual to get it started and refer to it more often than I normally need to. I love the radio. I have lived in areas with terrible reception so this is just fantastic. Yes you can get it all on your computer, but I like having the radio in the living room able to work independently of the computer.
customer_reviews.author: Ginny's Store

customer_reviews.title: Try Something Else . . . This Unit Has Major Problems
customer_reviews.text: We have high-speed internet but the unit keeps losing connectivity and it is not our service provider. I have checked on the Internet for known issues and apparently this is one of them. I kept it well beyond any time I should have hoping some firmware upgrade would fix it. I finally gave up and just do not use it.
customer_reviews.author: John M. Palamaro

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sound, limited station presets.
customer_reviews.text: This radio works well, but like all the others, has only 6 buttons for preset stations. I bought this as a bedside radio, and it is only usable for the 6 station that I've programmed it for, unless I want to set up, out of bed, and go through the menu to get to others. A real pain. Also has a nice remote control, which doesn't help with that problem. On the other hand, it does sound great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice little box
customer_reviews.text: This is my second internet radio. The first was another brand and is now retired after less than a year of service and a trip to the warranty repair center. I'm much happier with this second one. It has a faster startup cycle, and better controls. I've had it about 3 months, and it's already gone through a couple of system upgrades, which are pretty simple and mostly automated. I'm happy so far.
customer_reviews.author: Stu TO

customer_reviews.title: Good sound but problems connecting
customer_reviews.text: I love the radio but often have problems getting an internet radio station to come in. sometimes the cause has been a faulty router on my computer, which I will replace. But even when the router is working we often have trouble bringing in a station. I got a message on the screen about downloading some program to improve the radio, but I don't know if the program was successfully downloaded, since I did not get a confirmation message. I love the radio when it's working!
customer_reviews.author: Virginia E. Vida

customer_reviews.title: I live in the USA, not Europe
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this and it shipped to an address in the US. It came with power plug plates for the adapter for European outlets. I ended up going and buying one locally rather than go through the process of sending it back and probably having the same problem again which Logitech said might take 6 weeks. Would think for a $200 item they would have a faster turnaround with their support. Probably the last thing I buy from Logitech.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good while it lasted
customer_reviews.text: I didn't quite make it two years with this. Now it can't connect to the Internet which is a fatal flaw in an Internet only radio. The settings indicate it's connected to the Internet but the wireless signal indicates it is not. I've tried numerous fixes but this time I've been unable to resurrect it. No more Logitechs for me.
customer_reviews.author: Proteanways

customer_reviews.title: great radio
customer_reviews.text: This radio has great sound. and connects to the internet, so can get stations from anywhere. wireless.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Leverett

customer_reviews.title: I use one everyday in the bathroom.
customer_reviews.text: I have many of the Squeezebox products including two of these. I like them a lot. The battery pack separates them from the rest of the line; you can use the radio where you don't have electric power but within range of your wifi, like in a bathroom or outside. It's sensitive to interfering wifi networks but many devices are.
customer_reviews.author: James Zachary

customer_reviews.title: Great Technology
customer_reviews.text: Nicest piece of new technology created in a long time. Lovin it! Computer remote controlled you can change stations, volume, install and remove apps and turn it on and off right from your pc. I only wished I had purchased the touch version as the on unit controls can only insert one character at a time but once logged in you don't have to log in again. I expect technology to explode soon a better alternative to satellite.
customer_reviews.author: JWalt

customer_reviews.title: Great product.  Decent sound
customer_reviews.text: I already had a Squeezebox server Internet account so it seamlessly imported by Pandora radio stations, and also showed by iTunes library. The speaker is nothing great but works well for such a small, portable radio. It doesn't have a remote but if you have an iphone you can download iPeng, which works great. Also the small indentation in the back allows you to carry the radio with one hand but does not feel very secure. Except for my minor complaints I'm happy I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: K. Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable wifi connectivity, etc
customer_reviews.text: Great idea and I like it when it works. Three main problems for me: 1. When PC sleeps wifi disconnects. 2. When you want to reconnect you have to kill the app manually each time you want it to connect then right click the app link to run as admin to get it to work on Win 7. 3. If frequently loses connectivity to local wifi (1 to 2 times each day) and then see (2) above...
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing!
customer_reviews.text: All I was expecting was a little radio that would pull in the station I wanted to hear but is located right on the edge of unavailablilty. What arrived is a little gem that's easy to use, sounds great, and pulls in stations I never dreamed of - world-wide. This baby is beautifully designed, intuitive, and a real quality product. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Bennett E. WernerTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: This is my second Squeezebox radio
customer_reviews.text: These radios are really great, lots of options and are portable if you get the optional battery, that really makes this a great radio. The first one I got was the black color, but, this one was the red one and I really do like it. Setup on a new one is sort of challenging, but, once you get it you are set and will work just fine for the life of the radio. Since I already had a setup, this one was easy.
customer_reviews.author: B. Mentor

customer_reviews.title: Great radio!
customer_reviews.text: I love this radio: amazing range of things it can do. But as someone who doesn't really know much about high-tech stuff, I wish it had come with more detailed directions. Very minimal directions and you would have to go online to know more.Still, it's a great buy. I have it in my kitchen so I can listen while I cook, and my son takes it into the garage for his ipod while he works out.
customer_reviews.author: cookbookie

customer_reviews.title: Great, but the Android app does not work with ...
customer_reviews.text: Great, but the Android app does not work with it. It a documented issue - check on line. So here we have a radio, with an Android App that is not update. Fast fingers are needed, and a microfiber cloth to clean the fingerprints off the case.
customer_reviews.author: Snapshot32

customer_reviews.title: I love love love my Squeezebox!
customer_reviews.text: I have it in the kitchen, which is where a working person seems to spend most of her or his time. I listen to "Radio Paradise" mostly, love the eclectic mix. I also listen to my Pandora stations on here. Great sound for a small unit, no complaints at all. Highly recommend Squeezebox. Highly recommend Radio Paradise.
customer_reviews.author: M Hill

customer_reviews.title: Great internet radio
customer_reviews.text: I love these squeezeboxes. I've bought three now. One for myself and two for gifts. I bought two of them used from Amazon, and they looked and work like brand new. They have great sound and are easy to use. I use mine mostly for Pandora, but some local radio stations as well. Getting the optional battery makes them more portable.
customer_reviews.author: DRH

customer_reviews.title: Logitech Squeezebox Radio Music Player with Color Screen (Black)
customer_reviews.text: I love my radio! It plays stations from all over the world and doesn't interfer with my computer. It is easy to use. Every now and then it will shut off and reset itself but that has to do with the servers from the station playing. I always thought it was on my end with my internet connection but understood after a phone call to the manufacturer and tech support from logitech who were very helpful and curteous. Every home should have one of these.
customer_reviews.author: sdaignea

customer_reviews.title: Sweet squeezebox
customer_reviews.text: Elegant design and easy/intuitive to use. Overall very pleased but what keeps me from giving it five stars across the board is its sound. There are no tone controls, which is surprising in this price class and that leaves you a sound that is in the bass-heavy realm. People with acute listening capabilities might even describe it as a tad "muddy" sounding. However, most will be please with its silken sound.
customer_reviews.author: A. Fracaro

customer_reviews.title: Coolest gear of 09/2010
customer_reviews.text: This is the coolest gift you can give and the coolest item you can get for yourself. The red one is sexy. The music is perfect. Sound quality is Bose-esque. If you like Pandora on your Iphone then you'll really enjoy having this. I enjoy the preset station buttons. I easily toggle between my Jimmy Buffett station, my Mindy Smith station and my Matt Redmond. If you have to find a gift for someone who has everything, this is it.
customer_reviews.author: Dirk McPhearson

customer_reviews.title: Bad Luck
customer_reviews.text: We fell in love with the squeezebox when my brother purchased one and we were able to listen to European broadcasts... it sounded wonderful. However, when we ordered one, it had a defective part and wouldn't link up with our server. Customer Service was very apologetic and quick to refund our money, but now we are hesitant to repurchase.
customer_reviews.author: Alma

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This continues to be a great system after over 6 years of use. I have 3 in my house and sync with iPeng. I gave my mom and dad one around the same time. All 5 work like new today. Don't know why they were discontinued. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Grogan

customer_reviews.title: Terrific product with remarkable sound for a radio that opens up the world
customer_reviews.text: Easily set up and used and incredible sound for a small radio. Enjoy music, news, and other features from around the world. I've recommended it to other friends, many from other countries who lie in the U.S., and they all love it while they enjoy programming from their own part of the world that is otherwise inaccessible.
customer_reviews.author: D. Squires

customer_reviews.title: Love hate
customer_reviews.text: Had the SB for 3 trs now. Most of the time it played great, then it started losing it's wireless connection. Then the radio would just quit, restarting the SB would all most always bring it back to life. Then one day it would not connect to the internet at all either wireless or with the cable. Tried everything that worked before, well it does not work now. Sent an email to Logtech asking a few questions, that they never answered. So I guess I'm on my own. Nice looking paper weight if nothing else.
customer_reviews.author: Chet   Bruzewski

customer_reviews.title: Slick!
customer_reviews.text: Have a squeeze Boom and love the sound and features but really too big for a bedside radio. Boom is now in a much larger room to show off its great sound. Squeeze Radio is perfect for the bedroom. Clock faces are better for bedside.. setup is a cinch and the mono sound is great. I'm not sure why others have had network issues.. none so far for me. very highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: J.W.B.

customer_reviews.title: This product ROCKS!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this Squeezebox radio! I ordered the red one for the kitchen and went back to order a black one for the bedroom. Get the battery pack for it and you have a power-outage proof alarm radio. The world of internet radio is at your fingertips with this product. Great display, great sound, great product!!!
customer_reviews.author: Woodsman

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product but a few annoyances
customer_reviews.text: We love this and glad we purchased it. It does as advertised. It takes a long time to come on when you turn it on (like 90 seconds.) It has to establish a connection to the internet kind of like a pc. Once it's on, it's great. I have tried putting it in standby mode to avoid the long start up a couple times but it seems to get hung up and I have to turn it to full off anyway. I'd still recommend it as it is great once on.
customer_reviews.author: treader

customer_reviews.title: Top quality
customer_reviews.text: This is a well-made product and perfectly fits the use for which it was purchased. We didn't encounter any of the (wireless) connectivity problems mentioned in some of the reviews an were easily able to load our existing Pandora and Tune-In Radio stations. We've added the compatible HQRP battery for use on our screen porch this spring/summer/fall. It installed easily and worked properly on a brief initial test. Logitech apparently released a newer model of the Squeezebox with an integrated battery just about the time of our purchase--that would be an even better value.
customer_reviews.author: Subway Alum

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Product
customer_reviews.text: First of all we love this product and recommend it. I have listened to music that was archived deep in my hard drive that I did not listen to for many years (I actually listen to music now). Only one small issue, I am not sure if it is my wireless network or the squeezebox, but occasionally the squeezebox has trouble connecting to my home network. Usually a restart of the squeezebox or my computer (or both) fixes it.
customer_reviews.author: CustomerT

customer_reviews.title: Nice Product, Easy Set-up
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice product, does what it says it will do. As easy to set-up as streaming on your iPod. It's quite intuitive. You will need to install an APP for some radio stations; easy to do. (Not all radio stations can be accessed without a streaming APP; that's not Logitech's issue.) I would prefer that a remote controller was included (standard).
customer_reviews.author: J. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great radio
customer_reviews.text: I bought this radio for my wife. She loves it!! The controls are easy, setup is easy and sound quality is great. It was up and running, playing internet stations as well as music from our home computer in less than 30 minutes out of the box. I highly recommend this for a kitchen or office radio. It isn't a home theater but for a boombox type radio it's great. I am planning on getting one for my detached garage now.
customer_reviews.author: That guy

product_meta.title: Logitech Squeezebox Radio Music Player with Color Screen (Black) (Discontinued by Manufacturer)
product_meta.description:
Color:BlackLogitech Squeezebox Radio (BLACK) brings a world of music-free Internet radio, subscription services, or your personal digital music collection - to any space in your home, over your Wi-Fi network.Connections: 1xHeadphones(Mini-phone stereo 3.5 mm), 1xAudio line-in(Mini-phone stereo 3.5 mm), 1xNetwork(RJ-45),Headphone Jack: Yes.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER


CES 2010 Innovations Award
Honoree in Audio Components CategoryNovember 2009LOGITECH SQUEEZEBOX RADIO WI-FI MUSIC PLAYER (BLACK)
Global stations. Endless music. Simple as turning on the radio.
Starting now, you can listen to music, news and sports from every corner of the globe, all without a computer. It's easy with the Logitech Squeezebox Radio. Just turn it on and tune in to thousands of free Internet radio stations, the hottest online music services, even your own personal music collection. Your listening options are as limitless as the Internet—in any room where you have a Wi-Fi connection.

Tune in to your limitless playlist.

SqueezeBox Radio
Noteworthy Features

 * Free local stations from every corner of the Internet
 * Access music services like Pandora, Rhapsody, Slacker and SIRIUS Internet Radio
 * Your digital music stored on your home PC or Mac
 * You can even plug in your iPod

enlargeYour all-in-one Wi-Fi music player—no computer, no clutter, and no limits.
The compact Logitech Squeezebox Radio works with your Wi-Fi network to stream a world of crystal-clear music to any room you want. Just plug it in and turn the dial to connect to an underground rock station in Amsterdam, talk show in Sydney, sports coverage from Boston or BBC news from London. Discover millions of tracks from online services like Last.fm and Pandora. With its built-in high-fidelity amplifier and speakers, you'll enjoy room-filling sound—all from a little music player that fits easily on a corner of your kitchen counter, bedroom night table, or desk in the den. 

enlargeHigh-quality audio with built-in premium speakers—big sound in a small package
You only need a little space to fill any room with rich stereo sound. This ultra-compact Wi-Fi music player is as small as a clock radio. But it's designed with big audio technology. Support for high-resolution encoding captures the wide range of details that make your digital music come to life. And the integrated high-definition tweeter and long-throw subwoofer make sure you enjoy a full sound experience, from crisp, clean high notes to warm mid-range and deep bass. 

enlargeVivid color screen for easy browsing at the turn of a dial
What would you like to hear? The best of Internet radio around the planet? Commercial-free classical music? Your favorite party playlist on your computer down the hall? The full-color screen and intuitive menus make it easy to browse your way—album art included. Just turn the control dial and make your selection. It's that simple. Plus, six pre-set buttons put your favorite stations and services at your fingertips.

enlargeFree SqueezeNetwork for direct access to a world of Internet stations and music services
With so many Internet stations and music services, the choices can be daunting. That's why Logitech created the SqueezeNetwork. It's an online service that organizes a world of music, so it's a breeze to access the stations, artists and services that match your tastes. Sign up for free and get connected right on your Squeezebox Radio. 

enlargeConnects to Facebook for sharing music recommendations with friends
Say you just discovered a killer indie band track on your Squeezebox Radio. Now you can tell your friends about it instantly. Display your Facebook home page and browse your friends' walls right on the screen. You can even set your Facebook photos or news feed as your screensaver. So you can send them music recommendations the moment you hear that amazing track or Internet radio station—and receive theirs, all without a computer.

enlargeEasy setup connects you to Internet stations in minutes
Just turn on the power and the music player automatically finds your home Wi-Fi network. You also have the option to plug in an Ethernet cable. Either way, in just five minutes you'll be able to start listening to stations across the planet.

enlargeLine-in cord lets you plug in your iPod
Do you want to listen to your iPod tunes in any room? Simple. Your Squeezebox Radio comes complete with a cord and built-in jack for your iPod or other MP3 player. Just plug it in and you're ready to rock.

Convenient seven-day alarm and auto-dimming display
Wake up to NPR news, soft jazz from Paris or your own morning playlist. Or choose a different station and wake-up time for every day of the week. And when it's time to go to bed, don't worry about a bright display keeping you awake. It automatically dims when the lights go out, so you can rest easy. 

enlargeIncrease your listening optionsTake your music around the house and control it from across the room with the Logitech Squeezebox Acessory Pack (sold seperately). It includes a rechargeable battery pack and infrared remote control designed specifically for your Squeezebox Radio. 

COMPATIBILITY
WHAT'S IN THE BOX?
 * Logitech Squeezebox Radio 
 * Power adapter with removable plug 
 * Line-in cord for most iPod and other MP3 players with standard 3.5 mm jack 
 * User documentation 
 * 2-year limited hardware warranty

SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS:
Windows-based PC * Windows XP, Windows 2000, Windows NT, Windows Vista, or Windows 7

Mac computer *  Mac OS X 10.3.5 or later 

For access to music on your computer use Squeezebox software with the minimum system requirements:

 * 256 MB RAM and 80 MB available hard disk space With any of the following operating systems: 
 * Windows XP/2000/NT/7, Windows Vista, 733 MHz Pentium 
 * Mac OS X 10.3.5 or later 
 * Linux/BSD/Solaris (Perl 5.8.3 or later) 
 * Ethernet or 802.11b/g wireless home network 
 * Broadband Internet connection required for Internet radio and music services 

COMPARE
WHICH SQUEEZEBOX WI-FI MUSIC PLAYER IS RIGHT FOR YOU? 

Squeezebox Radio
Squeezebox TouchHighlightCompact design with high quality sound Color touch-screen with rich, full digital music through your stereo or powered speakersGreat for * Kitchen 
 * Bedroom 
 * Home office 
 * Patio 
 * Anywhere without a stereo!

 * Living room 
 * Anywhere with a stereo or powered speakers 
 * On your desk 

Which should you choose? * You want big sound in a small space. 
 * You are someone who likes to listen while you work. You need something to fit in your work area. 
 * You want music in every room of your home and you want to be able to control it from anywhere.
